title: Scarcity, Opportunity Cost, and Incentives
description: Understanding the fundamental economic problem of scarcity and how opportunity costs and incentives drive all economic decisions, with application to major life choices including college, career, and financial priorities.
learning_objectives: Define scarcity and explain why it's the fundamental economic problem
Calculate opportunity costs for personal finance decisions
Identify explicit and implicit costs in financial choices
Analyze how incentives shape behavior in different economic systems
Apply opportunity cost analysis to major life decisions including college, career, and housing

skill_builder.title: Opportunity Cost Calculator
skill_builder.description: An interactive tool where students calculate opportunity costs for major life decisions, evaluate trade-offs in budget allocation, and design incentive systems aligned with personal financial goals.
